CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 1 reads: "Where Workman Died - Samuel Ogburn, 2821 Wylie Ave., center, and Fred Stroud, 1100 Wheeler St., right, watch Paul Keibler, left, operator of rigs for Allegheny County Sanitation Authority, flush the manhole in which they were taking five-minute turns working, when Willie Louis Mitchell, 28, of 1709 Colwell St., was overcome by "black damp" sewer gas. A pump sends water from river into manhole, leading to the sewer into which the river had backed debris form Herr's Island slaughter houses before sewer was finished. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of three men, left to right: Fred Stroud, Samuel Ogburn, and Paul Keibler, watching water pumping from river into manhole
